chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Mathew E. Wilber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Deferred Prosecution Agreement - Count 1 for 2 years
Successfully complete probation on counts 2 and 3
The defendant shall not engage in any conduct which would lead an impartial magistrate to find probable cause exists to believe that the defendant has committed a violation of the criminal laws of the United States or the State of Wisconsin or of any ordinances adopting the same.
Pay restitution (probation)
Have no direct or indirect contact with Sam Waite Auto Sales
Submit to, comply with and complete any counseling, assessments, treatment and/or AODA requested by the probation agent and follow through with any and all treatment recommendations made
Within 5 days of contact with provider, execute any and all written release
Provide DA's office with written proof of full compliance with this agreement prior to review date
If complies - dismiss
Non-compliance - formal sentencing
Bond continued

supervisions.notes: The Court does not object to early discharge if all restitution is paid and Agent recommends.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall have no contact with Sam Wait Auto Sales or go upon the business's premises.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not possess any alcohol unless has written authorization by his Agent.

Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall take prescriptions in the manner and method as prescribed by his physician.

ADA Fassbender present.
Def. present - in custody.

No objection to terminate DPA.
Court terminates the DPA - court finds def. guilty of Ct. #1 (burglary).
State is in compliance w/victim notifications.
Recommendations by counsel.
Ct. #2 and Ct. #3 - CJ be entered for fine & costs only - no CJ to be entered on RHT - to be collected thru probation on Ct. #1 - time served on both counts.
Ct. #1 - probation - SW - 3 years
Conditions:
1.  pay costs of the action.
2.  def. to provide DNA sample.
3.  def. to pay RHT to Sam Wait Auto Sales and Pekin Insurance - 10% RHT surcharge to not be applied.
4.  def. to participate in any assessments or counseling deemed appropriate by his Agent and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
5.  def. to have no contact with Sam Wait Auto Sales or go upon the business's premises.
6.  def. to not posses any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
7.  def. to take prescriptions in the manner and method as prescribed by his physician.
8.  def. to not posses any alcohol unless written authorization by his Agent.
Def. to meet w/P&P.
Appeal rights explained to def.
Firearm restrictions explained to def.
Voter ineligibility restrictions explained to def.
If agent recommends early discharge if all RHT is paid - the Court does not object.

Ct. #1 - NC plea

Plea questionnaire filed with the Court.
Court questions def.
DPA filed with the Court.
The Court finds the def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis exists and finds def. guilty of Ct. #2 and amended Ct. #3.  The Court will accept plea, but will withhold finding of guilt and places matter into DPA for a period of 2 years re:  Ct. #1.
State is in compliance w/victim notifications.
Recommendations by counsel.
Probation - SW - 2 years (concurrent).
Conditions:
1.  pay costs of the action including restitution surcharge of $262.25.
2.  pay restitution of $2622.45 (as reflected on restitution summary) - Wait Auto Sales should receive restitution prior to reimbursing the insurance company.
3.  def. to participate in any assessments as directed by his Agent and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
4.  def. to continue in his aftercare programming and not terminate such programming w/o consent of his provider.
5.  def to participate in any other counseling as directed by his Agent.
Appeal rights explained to def.
Def. to meet w/P&P today.
51 days credit, if revoked.
